revised_title: Making Maple Sugar from Upland Maple Trees in New England
tldr: This article explains the process of making maple sugar from the juice of the Upland Maple tree in New England. The author, Paul Dudley, describes how to tap the tree, collect the sap, and boil it down to produce sugar. He also mentions that maple sugar is considered to be as good for common use as West India sugar and even has greater medicinal virtues according to physicians.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Forestry and Agroforestry
